text: Hi Dave. just tried to run the marble example for testing this feature <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1669/>
I have installed couchdb in my localhost and set the couchdb toggle flag to true.

When it tries to call the PUT in SaveBytesbyDoc() , I am getting the following response.. ===DME got a status code >= 400: &{404 Object Not Found 404 HTTP/1.1 1 1 map[Content-Length:[44] Cache-Control:[must-revalidate] Server:[CouchDB/1.5.0 (Erlang OTP/R16B03)] Date:[Tue, 11 Oct 2016 18:08:41 GMT] Content-Type:[application/json]] 0xc82012eb40 44 [] false map[] 0xc82010c380 <nil>}
===DME response body: {"error":"not_found","reason":"no_db_file"}
not sure if I am missing something..
Update: Was able to get past this error after creating the marbles_app Database ```curl -X PUT <http://127.0.0.1:5984/marbles_app>```
<@U2MCH9EEB> please post your question to the more general ‘fabric’ channel, more likely somebody there can answer it.
<@U24M29R4G> Great news… always important to see it work for a 2nd person.  I’ve updated the commit message to mention the db creation step.

First prototype of pluggable/queryable state database is complete.  Would love any feedback.  Summary of assets:
Charts in Jira: <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-60>
Demo in playback channel: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/archives/playbacks>
Prototype code in Gerrit: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1669/>
<@U1KFCPFQA> thanks for updating the commit message.
my pleasure
